place.name: BURTON
place.gazetteerText: BURTON-BY-LINCOLN, a parish in the district and county of Lincoln; near the Great Northern railway, 2 miles NNW of Lincoln. Post Town, Lincoln. Acres, 2,325. Real property, £3,548. Pop., 171. Houses, 36. The manor and Burton House belong to Lord Monson. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £419.* Patron, Lord Monson. The church is modern. Charities, £43. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
